item.title: Dynamic programming problems
item.description: Here is a list of all dynamic programming tasks from this blog.

item.title: Leetcode 303. Immutable range sum query
item.description: Calculate sum of array elements for any given indexes, keeping source array immutable at the same time Range Sum Query - Immutable.

item.title: Leetcode 198. House robber
item.description: Another easy task is about smart house robbery approach.

item.title: Leetcode 53. Maximum subarray
item.description: From a given array find the maximum contiguous subarray with the largest sum, Leetcode 53.

item.title: Leetcode 121. Best time to buy and sell stock
item.description: Let’s condsider easy dynamic problem: best time to buy and sell stock. This is Leetcode 121. Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock.

item.title: Leetcode 746. Min cost climbing stairs
item.description: Let’s condsider another easy dynamic problem: minimal cost of climbing stairs. This is Leetcode 746. Min Cost Climbing Stairs.

item.title: Leetcode 70. Climbing stairs
item.description: Let’s condsider easy dynamic problem: climbing stairs. This is Leetcode 70. Climbing stairs.

item.title: Timus 1005. Stone pile
item.description: This is a first post which describes how to solve some particular programming task. Today we will consider Stone pile task from Timus. It is clear and easy. The task sounds like: Task Stone pile Task You have a number of stones with known weights w1, …, wn. Write a program that will rearrange the stones into two piles such that weight difference between the piles is minimal. Input Input contains the number of stones n (1 ≤ n ≤ 20) and weights of the stones w1, …, wn (integers, 1 ≤ wi ≤ 100000) delimited by white spaces.
